<p>Dataset here we used comes from <a href="https://datahub.io/core/population">Datahub.io</a></p>
Including population figures for countries, regions (e.g. Asia) and the world. Data comes originally from World Bank and has been converted into standard CSV. Data

<h3>Load Package and Data</h3>
```{r}
library(broom)
library(tidyverse)
library(magrittr)
pop_data <- read.csv("posts/dashboard_1/population_csv.csv")
```

<h3>Show the world population by year</h3>

```{r}
# Filter the Data
pop_all <- pop_data %>%
    filter(Country.Code == "WLD")

#Visualize
ggplot(pop_all, aes(x = Year, y = Value)) + 
  geom_line() + 
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(title = "World Population", x = "Year", y = "Population")
```
